problem_text:
21.100. Suppose that A and G are finite groups such that A acts coprimely on G by automorphisms. Let C = CG(A) be the fixed-point subgroup, and let C′ denote its derived subgroup.
Is it true that the number of A-invariant irreducible characters χ of G whose restriction χC is never zero is exactly |C/C′|? This would follow if one could show that χC is never zero if and only if the Glauberman–Isaacs correspondent χ∗ of χ is linear.
G. Navarro
